column4: you might have some drivers from system->administration->hardwaredrivers
yes, it says the driver version is "current", but no mention of the exact driver version
aah, thats screwed up. :)
what drivers are you looking at there?
maybe version 185 or higher
latest  is version 260
what does glxinfo tell you?
should i type that in the terminal? - "glxinfo"
do glxinfo | less in the terminal
terminal says that it cannot find the package glxinfo in the repo
can jockey give some answers?
never used it, but it certaninly seems helpful
i tried it in the terminal, it seems that there is no CLI for jockey
i'll installing sysinfo
not able to get x upp?
do you mean my dispaly? my display is working fine...i just wanted to update for the heck of it
i dont get why you dont run jockey then?
and it seems weird that you cant run glxinfo
there is no CLI for jockey
and the GUI for jockey only tells me that it is the current version, but no version name
ok, i found it using nvidia-settings; my current driver version is 195
the nvidia-settings GUI has glx information
thanx for the help
